conclusion: To determine the time it takes for the laser beam to exit the transparent brick at point C, analyze the path of the light using Snell's Law and geometry.
The laser beam starts at point A and travels towards O before exiting at point B or C.
Snell's Law: n sin θ_i = sin θ_r, where θ_i is the angle of incidence and θ_r is the angle of refraction.
For total internal reflection at point B, θ_r must satisfy θ_r ≥ arcsin(1/n).
The light travels from A to O in a straight line and forms an angle θ_i at O.
The critical angle at B occurs when θ_r = arcsin(1/n).
Time for straight line path AO is r/v.
Distance OB is r sin θ = r/n, and time through the brick is r/(nv).
The total time for the laser beam to emerge from the arc surface is (r/v)(1 + 1/n).
